physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Scattered petechiae on the chest, abdomen, and thighs; tender purpuric lesion on the right shoulder without crepitus; mild neck stiffness.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Within 90 minutes, the temperature rose to 39.0°C and the pulse increased to 122 bpm. Over the next 3 hours, additional petechiae developed on trunk, arms, and legs. By the first hospital day, fever and tachycardia resolved but mild nuchal rigidity persisted.
